text: hi everyone the mustache must go here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for
a
review of this new fire tools album
eternal home fire tools is the musical
project of
singer composer
producer multi-instrumentalist
and songwriter angel markloyd who's been
spinning tangled progressive and glitchy
webs of metal electronics and vaporwave
for years now last year's rainbow bridge
did leave an impression on me but also
left me uh very dizzy as it had so many
perplexing compositions and genre
combinations on it which were kind of
difficult to digest but there was an
undeniable genius to it that kept fire
tools in my head now the newest fire
tools record here is an even larger
offering at 80 minutes split up among
four shorter portions that run about 20
minutes each and here we get deeper and
even more insane combinations of uh
blackened vapor jazz prague and yeah
that sounds nuts but a lot of portions
of this record are legitimately bonkers
but simultaneously in terms of a sound i
think angel has stumbled upon something
special here her classic raspy ghoulish
black metal style vocals do bring a
serious kick to the glossy and idyllic
beds of synths that paint a lot of these
cuts in a way it sort of illustrates
just how much common ground black metal
and vaporwave and new age music actually
have because there is something
similarly atmospheric cold isolating and
singular about the sound both of these
genres traditionally create so this
leads to a lot of tracks that are grim
and visceral yes but also very vast and
awe-inspiring too so fire tools
undoubtedly plays with a lot of space a
lot of atmosphere on this project but
it's far from sounding washed out
there's little to no navel gazing done
on this record if anything many of the
ideas on this project are unfolding and
developing very quickly there are so
many chord changes and drum fills and
melodic jazzy eruptions all over these
tracks that are difficult to wrap your
head around and to really nail down the
drumming like my god it's so good on
this record the fills and the groove
changes on some of these tracks are
insane i don't know if it's all
sequenced or it's an electronic kit but
either way those fills are tight those
blasts are also tight sometimes
everything sounding so synthetic does
take the wind out of the sails of some
of the moments on the lp where
everything is firing on all cylinders
like in the latter portions of odd cat
sanctuary but this track still makes for
some of the most righteous black gays
i've heard in a minute even with those
sugary christmas synths dancing on top
but while there is a lot of chaos to be
found on eternal home there are quite a
few cuts that hit with very consistent
and exhilarating grooves too like on
yearning alchemical fire which features
wonderous synthesizers topping these
driving
electro-industrial beats lots of black
metal style vocals in the mix too the
whole track sounds like hacking into the
mainframe using uh
black magic then the fantastically
titled umbilical cord blood has more
industrially engineered rhythms with an
array of tense dystopian synthesizer
passages uh that really come together
when we get this marvelous and mystical
sac solo that colors the whole back end
of the track now this is the final
portion of the first act of the project
and from here moving into the first song
of the second portion of the second
section it's like being born all over
again into a cyber black metal
apocalypse this is easily one of the
most crushing and aggressive moments on
this entire lp but what follows are a
series of tracks and passages that are
some of the most ambient and beautiful
and abstract on the entire project from
the lonely glitches and mournful
melodies on softly chewing quiet stars
to the airy enveloping synthesizers and
meditative drones on rubber band wrist
there's also the interdimensional eyes
without a brain progressive path i think
was the only spot on the second disc i
didn't care for too much which is mostly
due to the weak nasally singing on the
cut combined with the emo influenced
guitar passages not a stylistic shift i
was anticipating or think was done super
well but i guess it does help usher in
the third portion of the project which i
think is the most eclectic thick flowy
glowy sparkly stingy pain features a lot
of crushing metal riffs sparkling post
metal arpeggios too instrumentally it's
a solid cut but again on the vocal end
i'm not crazy about what goes down as
the heavy-handed manipulations leave the
singing
sounding like an unintelligible buzz i
much prefer the following track where on
earth is my sacha denanda which is some
blackened pop rock with impenetrable
shoegaze guitars in the mix just
enveloping everything a very strange and
unlikely combination of styles but it
actually goes over very well the
following cut feels like i've been
teleported to a digital heavy metal
rainforest with its rifts and primal
rhythms and the last several cuts of
this portion of the disc just continue
to push this record's fantastical limits
what's going on with these tracks
compositionally and stylistically is
indescribable honestly but what i will
say is fire tools is very much world
building on these cuts and many others
because the more i listen to this record
the less i feel like i'm on earth now
the final disc i think has some
highlights as well but uh at least
sonically and compositionally it doesn't
really bring the whole
experience of this project a greater
sense of finality or anything like that
it mostly continues a lot of the same
mayhem there's lots of busy prague synth
metal passages on off to las vegas
there's also the geometric industrial
idm of outside bears one thing i will
say though on to make hole be whole
there does seem to be at least a bit of
narrative closure with angel singing
pretty frankly about moving to a small
town
finding some kind of consistency and
serenity in her life the very end of the
track presenting this refrain claiming
that she will not die it's a track very
much about thriving and surviving
meanwhile the following cut the closer
uh reflects a lot on
transcending the physical realm wanting
to be a cloud or just i guess outside of
your
this this
disgusting bone bag limitation that
we're stuck with in this realm which is
maybe reflected in the composition of
the song and the uh smattering of
glitchy and
disjointed sounds and samples on the
track too it does feel quite formless in
a way but in as efficient a way that i
can sum it up that is the record right
there it is a beautiful album it's an
extreme album it is a creative album
it's a mind-bending album but it's not a
record that's not without its issues at
least in my eyes there are some tracks
that i think
and a little abruptly or at least
progress very quickly almost as if angel
is trying to speedrun the record even
though it is 80 minutes long and she
does seem to give herself a lot of time
to build these tracks there are quite a
few that hit very quickly and feature
great ideas but maybe they're not
brought to as grand or exciting an end
as they could i am a clouds riffs and
grooves and pacing i found to be a
little tedious as well that's maybe the
the biggest drag on the entire record
and finally there is something a little
overbearing about the
size of this record and the way it all
plays out amongst these four portions
sectioned out into seven or six tracks
each there is something very complicated
about this record that makes me hesitant
to just jump right back into it but by
that same token uh it's that same
quality it's that same characteristic
that makes it so awe-inspiring to me as
well feeling a decent two strong seven
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head it's another video that you
can check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
fire tools
forever
